timeline.message: KOGITO-1798: Disable example failing tests with persistence until defects are fixed

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it have more sense to keep there AFTER_EACH_TEST_METHOD?
timeline.author: sutaakar

timeline.bodyText: IMHO it should be rather placed in AfterEach so the test cleans up after it has been executed.
timeline.author: sutaakar

replies.bodyText: In Quarkus version, it was being done before each test and it does not really matter if done before or after....
replies.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: Yes, though it may affect other tests when the cleanup is done in Before phase.
replies.author: sutaakar

replies.bodyText: It's not going to be an issue since no more tests are using the order process, but will do.
replies.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: I usually prefer to have the clean up done in the before method. That helps if you run let's say a separated service ( infinispan ? ) so the state is always the expected one when the test executes.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I agree with you. Usually, I do this stuff in the before methods as a setup configuration of my test suite. What do you think about @sutaakar ? Let me know whether reverting this or keeping it like this.
replies.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: @Sgitario I don't have a strong preference in that, if you think it is better to do the cleanup before then feel free to do so.
replies.author: sutaakar

replies.bodyText: In order to avoid to have an afterEach and a beforeEach both in the Spring Boot examples, I've changed it to be done in the beforeEach method as at the beginning.
replies.author: Sgitario
